title: Naringenin attenuates hepato-nephrotoxicity induced by aluminum nanoparticles through the mitigation of oxidative stress and apoptosis.
abstract: Aluminum nanoparticles (Al-NPs) are produced by the biodegradation of naturally occurring aluminium metal which can induce physiological toxicities. Naringenin (NAR) is a natural flavonoid possessing therapeutic properties, particularly encountering the toxicity associated with heavy metals.
journal: Journal of trace elements in medicine and biology : organ of the Society for Minerals and Trace Elements (GMS)
